skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: The Drakwald Forest is vast and treacherous, and many monstrosities such as Beastmen, Orcs and Minotaurs make their lairs deep within it. These creatures are dangerous and savage, and must be purged from time to time lest their numbers grow out of control. Finding these lairs is difficult, and so the Middenlanders use packs of Hunting Hounds to sniff them out and hunt them down. These packs are often led by Hunt Masters, who guide them towards the foe.

effects.description:
Bonus vs. Large: +10 for Imperial Hunting hounds
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: A lifetime spent hunting in the Imperial forests primes one to face a different kind of prey across the battlefield.

effects.description:
Range: +12% for Huntsmen and Archers
	(all units in army)

Bonus vs Large ammo for Huntsmen and Archers units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing which leaves, roots, berries and mushrooms can be safely eaten, and which will kill you stone dead, is a distinct advantage on campaign.
These arrows will kill of course, but are mainly used to cause a disorientating, explosive spectacle to unnerve the enemy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Such advanced ballistic skills tend to rub off on one's subordinates.
The more, the deadlier, the merrier.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
It may be cruel, but the power to burn the foe to ash is extremely useful when you want to be sure of winning.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
As they careen and stagger about, their flesh irreparably charred beyond recognition, perhaps the foe will rue the day they made war on the Empire?
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars  units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars  units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, Halberdiers, Stevedores and Sigmar Templars units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Hunting Hounds, Empire Knights, Reiksguard, and Knights of the Blazing Sun units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +5% for Empire Knights, Reiksguard, Knights of the Black Rose and Knights of the Blazing Sun units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for Hunting Hounds, Empire Knights, Reiksguard, and Knights of the Blazing Sun units
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Empire Knights, Reiksguard, Knights of the Black Rose and Knights of the Blazing Sun units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +9 for Hunting Hounds, Empire Knights, Reiksguard, and Knights of the Blazing Sun units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +6% for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +9% for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Greatswords and Demigryph Knights units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

effects.description:
Ward save: 7% for War Wagon, Steam Tank, Luminark of Hysh and Celestial Hurricanum units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +4% for War Wagon, Steam Tank, Luminark of Hysh and Celestial Hurricanum units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 11% for War Wagon, Steam Tank, Luminark of Hysh and Celestial Hurricanum units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +8% for War Wagon, Steam Tank, Luminark of Hysh and Celestial Hurricanum units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 15% for War Wagon, Steam Tank, Luminark of Hysh and Celestial Hurricanum units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +4% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +6% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun and Helstorm Rocket Battery units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour: 10 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Halberdiers, Greatswords and Flagellants (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The veteran marksman knows the precise range required to land the killing shot.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +12% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Missile, Missile Cavalry and Missile Chariot units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Empire Knight and Demigryph units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +20% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh, Celestial Hurricanum and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh, Celestial Hurricanum and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Mortar, Great Cannon, Helblaster Volley Gun, Helstorm Rocket Battery, War Wagon, Luminark of Hysh, Celestial Hurricanum and Steam Tank units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Applies +50% Flame Weakness and -48% Speed on contact
Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.
"The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!
"If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away."
The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
